cds.java.project.actors

Class SantaClaus

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • cds.java.project.actors.SantaClaus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class SantaClaus
extends java.lang.Thread
    Implementation of Santa Claus under the form of a thread; Santa's job is to get the gifts from the pipe that he shares with all his reindeer; then he has to put it in his bag of presents
    Since:
    2018-12-31
    Author:
    Buse-Dragomir Alexandru

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ConcurrentQueue<ChristmasGift> christmasGiftPipe
      Pipe that goes from the reindeer squad to Santa's place; all reindeer put their packed gifts in it, and on his side, Santa is taking them alone, one by one, and putting them in his big Christmas bag
      private ChristmasGift currentGiftBeingProcessed
      Member that saves the current gift that is processed by Santa; it can be null if Santa Claus has not gotten one yet from the pipe
      private int numberOfKids
      An approximation/estimation of the number of kids for this problem
      private boolean runningFlag
      Flag that ensures the time length of Santa's work; when true, the thread keeps running; once set to false, Santa finished its job
      private java.util.List<ChristmasGift> santaClausBagOfGifts
      List that simulates Santa's Christmas bag

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        MAX_PRIORITY, MIN_PRIORITY, NORM_PRIORITY

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SantaClaus(int numberOfKids, ConcurrentQueue<ChristmasGift> christmasGiftPipe)
      Constructor for the class that sets the number of kids and the shared pipe between Santa Claus and his reindeer; the running flag is set by default to true

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ConcurrentQueue<ChristmasGift> getChristmasGiftPipe()
      Getter method for the pipe shared by reindeer and Santa
      ChristmasGift getCurrentGiftBeingProcessed()
      Getter method for the current gift that is being processed by Santa; if no gift has been taken yet from the pipe, an error message is printed and null is returned
      java.util.List<ChristmasGift> getListOfAllChristmasGifts()
      Getter method for the list of all Christmas gifts
      int getNumberOfKids()
      Getter method for the number of kids that have been kind and deserve a present
      java.util.List<ChristmasGift> getSantaClausBagOfGifts()
      Getter method for the bag of Christmas gifts that Santa owns
      private void putCurrentGiftInChristmasBag()
      Method that puts the current gift that has been processed in the Chrismas bag; the method has to be called after processing at least a gift from reindeer; otherwise, an error message is printed
      private void restAfterProcessingGift()
      Method that ensures the resting period for Santa after the processing process and the addition of a new gift to the bag; random short time between 10 and 20 milliseconds
      void run()
      run() method from Thread is overridden in order to ensure that Santa does its work correctly; the thread runs for a minute or until all gifts have been processed and put in the Christmas bag; the method consists of a series of method calls: taking the gift from the pipe, putting the current gift in the Christmas bag and finally resting for a short while before getting the next one; in the end, it is checked if the necessary number of toys has been obtained, case in which the thread will finish running
      void setChristmasGiftPipe(ConcurrentQueue<ChristmasGift> christmasGiftPipe)
      Setter method for the pipe shared by reindeer and Santa
      void setCurrentGiftBeingProcessed(ChristmasGift currentGiftBeingProcessed)
      Setter method for the current gift that is being processed by Santa
      void setListOfAllChristmasGifts(java.util.List<ChristmasGift> santaClausBagOfGifts)
      Setter method for the list of all Christmas gifts
      void setNumberOfKids(int numberOfKids)
      Setter method for the number of kids that have been kind and deserve a present
      void setSantaClausBagOfGifts(java.util.List<ChristmasGift> santaClausBagOfGifts)
      Setter method for the bag of Christmas gifts that Santa owns
      private void takeGiftFromPipe()
      Method that pops a gift from the pipe and stores it in the current gift memeber
      java.lang.String toString()
      toString() method from Object has been overridden in order to return the number of gifts that Santa has in his bag

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        activeCount, checkAccess, clone, countStackFrames, currentThread, destroy, dumpStack, enumerate, getAllStackTraces, getContextClassLoader, getDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler, getId, getName, getPriority, getStackTrace, getState, getThreadGroup, getUncaughtExceptionHandler, holdsLock, interrupt, interrupted, isAlive, isDaemon, isInterrupted, join, join, join, resume, setContextClassLoader, setDaemon, setDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler, setName, setPriority, setUncaughtExceptionHandler, sleep, sleep, start, stop, stop, suspend, yield

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        private ConcurrentQueue<ChristmasGift> christmasGiftPipe

      • currentGiftBeingProcessed

        private ChristmasGift currentGiftBeingProcessed
        Member that saves the current gift that is processed by Santa; it can be null if Santa Claus has not gotten one yet from the pipe

      • numberOfKids

        private int numberOfKids
        An approximation/estimation of the number of kids for this problem

      • runningFlag

        private boolean runningFlag
        Flag that ensures the time length of Santa's work; when true, the thread keeps running; once set to false, Santa finished its job

    • Constructor Detail

      • SantaClaus

        public SantaClaus(int numberOfKids,
                  ConcurrentQueue<ChristmasGift> christmasGiftPipe)
        Constructor for the class that sets the number of kids and the shared pipe between Santa Claus and his reindeer; the running flag is set by default to true

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        run() method from Thread is overridden in order to ensure that Santa does its work correctly; the thread runs for a minute or until all gifts have been processed and put in the Christmas bag; the method consists of a series of method calls: taking the gift from the pipe, putting the current gift in the Christmas bag and finally resting for a short while before getting the next one; in the end, it is checked if the necessary number of toys has been obtained, case in which the thread will finish running
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

        Setter method for the list of all Christmas gifts

        Setter method for the pipe shared by reindeer and Santa

      • getCurrentGiftBeingProcessed

        public ChristmasGift getCurrentGiftBeingProcessed()
        Getter method for the current gift that is being processed by Santa; if no gift has been taken yet from the pipe, an error message is printed and null is returned

        public void setCurrentGiftBeingProcessed(ChristmasGift currentGiftBeingProcessed)
        Setter method for the current gift that is being processed by Santa

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString() method from Object has been overridden in order to return the number of gifts that Santa has in his bag
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Thread

        private void takeGiftFromPipe()
        Method that pops a gift from the pipe and stores it in the current gift memeber

        Method that ensures the resting period for Santa after the processing process and the addition of a new gift to the bag; random short time between 10 and 20 milliseconds
